item.title: Preparation of Joseph Smith: The First Vision
item.description: As an answer to a fervent prayer, Joseph Smith sees God the Father and Jesus Christ.

item.title: Ministry of Joseph Smith: The Book of Mormon
item.description: Joseph Smith receives an ancient record from the angel Moroni and translates it by the power of the Holy Spirit into what is called the Book of Mormon.

item.title: Ministry of Joseph Smith: The Organization of the Church
item.description: Joseph teaches that the organization of the Church is the same today as in ancient times.

item.title: Preparation of Joseph Smith: Tutored by Heaven
item.description: Joseph was taught by God the Father, Jesus Christ, and other heavenly messengers the gospel that he was to share with the world. (D&C 128)

item.title: Preparation of Joseph Smith: Strengthened by Trials
item.description: Given many trials to bear at a young age, Joseph learns strength through adversity and learns to trust in the Lord.

item.title: Preparation of Joseph Smith: Faith in God, and a Desire to Know
item.description: Joseph Smith builds faith and gains a desire to know God's will through scripture study.

item.title: Preparation of Joseph Smith: Family Life
item.description: Joseph Smith's family help him learn about and build faith in God while he is young.

item.title: Ministry of Joseph Smith: The Restoration of Priesthood Authority
item.description: Priesthood authority is given to Joseph Smith by the Apostles Peter, James, and John.

item.title: Ministry of Joseph Smith: Sealed His Testimony with His Blood
item.description: Joseph Smith dies in Carthage Jail, a martyr for the cause of the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Teachings of Joseph Smith: The Nature of God
item.description: Joseph Smith teaches about the nature and character of our Heavenly Father.

item.title: Teachings of Joseph Smith: Preparing for Zion
item.description: Joseph Smith teaches that "any place where the Saints gather is Zion," and that "we ought to have the building up of Zion as our greatest object."

item.title: Teachings of Joseph Smith: Temple Ordinances
item.description: Joseph Smith teaches about the importance of temples and the ordinances which are received in them.

item.title: Teachings of Joseph Smith: The Book of Mormon
item.description: Joseph teaches that the Book of Mormon is the most correct book on earth.

item.title: Ministry of Joseph Smith: Temples
item.description: Joseph Smith establishes temple work as an essential purpose for the Saints of God.

item.title: Teachings of Joseph Smith: The Organization of the Church
item.description: Joseph Smith organizes The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints as commanded by God.

item.title: Testimony of Joseph Smith
item.description: Joseph bears testimony of Jesus Christ as recorded in the Doctrine and Covenants.

item.title: Ministry of Brigham Young: A Visionary Leader
item.description: Revelations given to Brigham Young direct the Saints to the Salt Lake Valley.

item.title: Preparation of Brigham Young: The Preparation of a Leader
item.description: God-given skills and life's education prepare Brigham to become a leader in the Church.

item.title: Preparation of Brigham Young: A Friend of the Prophet Joseph Smith
item.description: Brigham Young shows his love for Joseph Smith and sustains him as a prophet.

item.title: Preparation of Brigham Young: A Seeker of Truth
item.description: Brigham Young seeks for truth in all things.

item.title: Ministry of Brigham Young: A Faithful Missionary
item.description: Brigham Young dedicates years of his life to selfless missionary labors.

item.title: Ministry of Brigham Young: The Master Builder
item.description: Revelations from God direct the building of early Utah temples.

item.title: Teachings of Brigham Young: Hard Work, Sacrifice, Obedience
item.description: Brigham Young describes the blessings that come from faithfully facing life's challenges.

item.title: Teachings of Brigham Young: Devotion to Family
item.description: Brigham Young teaches the importance of eternal marriage and love of family.

item.title: Teachings of Brigham Young: Loyalty to God and His Servants
item.description: Brigham Young is dedicated to preaching the gospel and sustaining God's servants.

item.title: Testimony of Brigham Young
item.description: Brigham Young bears testimony of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Ministry of John Taylor: The Gifted Writer and Record-Keeper
item.description: John Taylor writes and edits for early Church newspapers in the U.S. and in Europe.

item.title: Preparation of John Taylor: Instructed Through Dreams and Visions
item.description: As a young man, John Taylor feels prompted to go to America to preach the gospel.

item.title: Preparation of John Taylor: A Boy Sensitive to the Things of God
item.description: As a boy, John Taylor is sensitive to spiritual promptings from heaven.

item.title: Ministry of John Taylor: Bold and Faithful Missionary
item.description: John Taylor is a successful, devoted missionary in the U.S., Canada, England, and France.

item.title: Ministry of John Taylor: Work for the Dead
item.description: John Taylor declares prophetic witness of temple work for the living and the dead.

item.title: Teachings of John Taylor: Charity
item.description: John Taylor instigates the Jublilee Celebration and invites all to remember the poor.

item.title: Teachings of John Taylor: Obedience
item.description: John Taylor demonstrates obedience to God despite the world's intolerance.

item.title: Teachings of John Taylor: Faith in God
item.description: John Taylor faithfully preaches to a hostile congregation.

item.title: Testimony of John Taylor
item.description: John Taylor bears testimony of the truthfulness of the restored Gospel of Christ.

item.title: Ministry of Wilford Woodruff: A Church Historian
item.description: God allows Wilford Woodruff to remember the talks of Church leaders until they are written and recorded.

item.title: Preparation of Wilford Woodruff: A Devoted Missionary
item.description: Wilford Woodruff is led by the Spirit to Benbow Farm, where hundreds are baptized.

item.title: Preparation of Wilford Woodruff: Personal Consecration
item.description: Wilford Woodruff witnesses of the truthfulness of consecrating all we have to God.

item.title: Preparation of Wilford Woodruff: A Spiritual Quest
item.description: As a young man, Wilford Woodruff senses the coming of a Restoration and is convinced of his need to serve God.

item.title: Ministry of Wilford Woodruff: The Work of the Temple
item.description: President Woodruff bears testimony of the great importance of temple work.

item.title: Ministry of Wilford Woodruff: The Manifesto of 1890
item.description: Wilford Woodruff defends the Manifesto that discontinues the practice of plural marriage.

item.title: Teachings of Wilford Woodruff: The Importance of Record Keeping
item.description: President Woodruff bears testimony of the importance of journals and record keeping.

item.title: Testimony of Wilford Woodruff
item.description: In his own recorded voice, Wilford Woodruff bears testimony of Joseph Smith and the restoration of the Gospel.

item.title: Teachings of Wilford Woodruff: The Importance of Teaching Our Children
item.description: President Woodruff teaches of the importance of bringing up our children in the ways of the Lord. Our children will be the leaders of the next generation.

item.title: Teachings of Wilford Woodruff: Gather Family Records
item.description: President Woodruff teaches the importance of finding the records of our ancestors and completing temple work for them.

item.title: Preparation of Lorenzo Snow: A Man Receptive to Truth
item.description: As a young man, Lorenzo Snow is introduced to the restored gospel and to the Prophet Joseph Smith.

item.title: Preparation of Lorenzo Snow: Preserved to Become a Prophet
item.description: After drowning, Lorenzo Snow is brought back to life on the shores of Hawaii.

item.title: Preparation of Lorenzo Snow: Complete Baptism and Silken Robes
item.description: Lorenzo Snow describes a spiritual experience that testified to him of the reality of God.

item.title: Ministry of Lorenzo Snow: A Vision of the Lord
item.description: Lorenzo Snow describes to his neice, Allie Young Pond, a visitation of the Lord within the Salt Lake Temple.

item.title: Ministry of Lorenzo Snow: A Faithful Missionary in Europe
item.description: While serving as a missionary on the borders of France and Italy, Elder Snow pronounces a blessing on a young boy. By the power of God, the boy is healed.

item.title: Teachings of Lorenzo Snow: Love for All Mankind: A Greeting to the World
item.description: In a proclamation to the world, President Snow shares a hope that hearts will turn to God and that all will live in obedience to His commandments.

item.title: Ministry of Lorenzo Snow: Leading the Church Out of Financial Bondage
item.description: While in St. George, Utah, President Snow receives direction from the Lord about the importance of obedience to the law of tithing.

item.title: Testimony of Lorenzo Snow
item.description: President Snow testifies of revelation, and of the restoration of the fulness of the Gospel.

item.title: Ministry of Joseph F. Smith: A Vision of the Redemption of the Dead
item.description: Nearing death, President Joseph F. Smith receives revelation from God regarding redemption of the dead.

item.title: Preparation of Joseph F. Smith: True Blue, Through and Through
item.description: Joseph F. Smith faces an unruly mob and declares fearlessly his membership in the Church.

item.title: Preparation of Joseph F. Smith: I Am Clean
item.description: Joseph F. Smith recounts a vision received as a young missionary in Hawaii that reinforces the love of family and the importance of living a clean life.

item.title: Preparation of Joseph F. Smith: The Example of a Mother
item.description: After the passing of both parents, young Joseph F. Smith remembers the love and teachings of his mother, Mary Fielding Smith.

item.title: Ministry of Joseph F. Smith: The Church Under National Scrutiny
item.description: President Joseph F. Smith, in Washington, D. C., defends Apostle/Senator Abraham Smoot and the Church before Congress and the anti-Mormon press.

item.title: Ministry of Joseph F. Smith: Family Home Evening Inaugurated
item.description: Joseph F. Smith defends the home and family and invites Church member to join him in setting aside weekly time soley for family activity and instruction.

item.title: Teachings of Joseph F. Smith: The Divine Nature of Home and Family
item.description: Joseph F. Smith teaches of the divine role of parents and family, and the importance of raising children in love and spiritual instruction.

item.title: Teachings of Joseph F. Smith: The Origin of Man
item.description: President Joseph F. Smith, with the First Presidency, issues a document titled, "The Origin of Man," summarizing the relationship between God and man.

item.title: Teachings of Joseph F. Smith: The Doctrine of the Godhead
item.description: President Joseph F. Smith, with the First Presidency, issues a doctrinal exposition on the Godhead, affirming their unity, and the distinct roles each member plays in the salvation of men.

item.title: Testimony of Joseph F. Smith
item.description: Recorded in his own voice, Joseph F. Smith admonishes Church members to serve faithfully and to know that he is firm in the faith.

item.title: Ministry of Heber J. Grant: The Welfare Plan
item.description: During the Depression years, President Grant receives revelation regarding the implementation and practice of a program that would teaches Church members self-reliance and care for the poor.

item.title: Preparation of Heber J. Grant: A Revelation of His Apostleship
item.description: Heber J. Grant receives revelation confirming his call to the apostleship.

item.title: Preparation of Heber J. Grant: A Young Stake President Learns Humility
item.description: Heber J. Grant tells of the humbling experiences of learning to speak in public and relying Heber J. Grant tells of the humbling experiences of learning to speak in public and relying

item.title: Preparation of Heber J. Grant: Persistence and Tenacity
item.description: Heber tells of boyhood desires to play baseball and to write legibly.

item.title: Ministry of Heber J. Grant: He Brought Financial Stability to the Church
item.description: Heber J. Grant's business expertise brings financial opportunities to the Church.

item.title: Ministry of Heber J. Grant: A Missionary in Japan
item.description: Heber J. Grant is called to open and preside over the Japanese mission.

item.title: Teachings of Heber J. Grant: A Yearning to Improve
item.description: President Grant teaches that persistence and tenacity are good, but we need to be doing what God would have us do.

item.title: Teachings of Heber J. Grant: Compassion for the Less Fortunate
item.description: Quiet acts of compassion mark the life of Heber J. Grant.

item.title: Teachings of Heber J. Grant: The Lord's Law of Financial Success
item.description: President Grant teaches members to pay an honest tithe and fast offering, and stay out of debt.

item.title: Testimony of Heber J. Grant
item.description: In his own voice, President Heber J. Grant testifies that God will answer the prayers of those who seek a testimony of Joseph Smith and of the truthfulness of the restored Gospel.

item.title: Ministry of George Albert Smith: Building Peace in a War-torn World
item.description: Despite the conflicts and tragedy of two World Wars, George Albert Smith teaches of peace through obedience to God's commandments.

item.title: Preparation of George Albert Smith: Blessings upon a Faithful Servant
item.description: George Albert Smith learns to trust in Heavenly Father, despite the challenges and obstacles of life.

item.title: Preparation of George Albert Smith: What Have You Done with My Name?
item.description: George Albert Smith has a dream in which his grandfather asks him what he has done with the Smith family name.

item.title: Preparation of George Albert Smith: A Patriarchal Blessing
item.description: George Albert Smith's patriarchal blessing prophesies of future leadership roles in Church.

item.title: Ministry of George Albert Smith: Love for His Fellowmen
item.description: George Albert Smith is an example of peace and love to the downtrodden, the minority, the apostate.

item.title: Ministry of George Albert Smith: Preserving Church Heritage
item.description: George Albert Smith celebrates the history of the Church and educates its members, by erecting monuments, marking trails, and identifying meaningful landmarks.

item.title: Teachings of George Albert Smith: A Personal Creed: The Praise of Men or the Praise of God
item.description: George Albert Smith pens a personal creed to guide the actions of his life. One element of this creed reminds him to value the praise of God over that of men.

item.title: Teachings of George Albert Smith: A Personal Creed: Care for the Needy
item.description: George Albert Smith pens a personal creed to guide the actions of his life. One element of this creed reminds him to care for those less fortunate.

item.title: Teachings of George Albert Smith: A Personal Creed: Be a Missionary
item.description: George Albert Smith pens a personal creed to guide the actions of his life. One element of this creed reminds him to be a missionary of the Lord's gospel.

item.title: Testimony of George Albert Smith
item.description: In his own voice, George Albert Smith bears testimony of the unique blessings we claim as members of the Church, and that the Lord will reign as Lord and King.

item.title: Ministry of David O. McKay: The Beginnings of a World-wide Church
item.description: As an apostle, David O. McKay is called upon to visit Church wards, branches, missions, and stakes throughout the world.

item.title: Preparation of David O. McKay: The Value of Education
item.description: Young David O. McKay excels in learning and chooses a career in education.

item.title: Preparation of David O. McKay: A Mission Experience
item.description: As a young missionary in Scotland, David O. McKay finds the stone inscription, "Whate'er thou art, act well thy part."

item.title: Preparation of David O. McKay: The Teachings and Example of Good Parents
item.description: As a young boy, David is taught the power of prayer, the importance of service, and the existence of God.

item.title: Ministry of David O. McKay: Temples Throughout the World
item.description: President David O. McKay is a temple builder, and invites members of the Church to stay in their native lands and build up the Church where they live.

item.title: Ministry of David O. McKay: Church Correlation
item.description: Under the direction of Apostle David O. McKay, the Church begins its efforts to correlate the work of the priesthood, the auxiliaries, and education within the Church.

item.title: Teachings of David O. McKay: Spirituality
item.description: President David O. McKay teaches the importance of growing closer to God, and aligning our desires and will with His.

item.title: Teachings of David O. McKay: Every Member a Missionary
item.description: President McKay reminds every member of his or her responsibility to live and preach the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Teachings of David O. McKay: The Importance of a Strong Family
item.description: President David O. McKay teaches the no other success can compensate for failure in the home.

item.title: Testimony of David O. McKay
item.description: In his own recorded voice, President McKay testifies that he who presides over the Church must be in tune with the head of the Church, even Jesus Christ.

item.title: Ministry of Joseph Fielding Smith: A Call to the Apostleship
item.description: Joseph Fielding Smith is called as an apostle, fulfilling the promise of a patriarchal blessing pronounced upon Joseph when he was a youth.

item.title: Preparation of Joseph Fielding Smith: The Example of a Righteous Father
item.description: Joseph Fielding Smith learns at the side of his father, Joseph F. Smith, the education is eternal, and that learning is done by study and faith.

item.title: Preparation of Joseph Fielding Smith: Learning Service in Family Duties
item.description: While in his youth, Joseph learns service while assisting his mother in her midwife duties.

item.title: Preparation of Joseph Fielding Smith: A Love of the Scriptures
item.description: As a boy, Joseph demonstrates his remarkable interest in studying the scriptures.

item.title: Ministry of Joseph Fielding Smith: The Worldwide Church
item.description: President Joseph Fielding Smith institutes conferences across the globe, where the teachings of the Gospel could strengthen Church members in their native lands.

item.title: Ministry of Joseph Fielding Smith: The Church Historian
item.description: Joseph Fielding Smith plays a key role in caring for the history of the Church, and in and the Church, were on trial.

item.title: Teachings of Joseph Fielding Smith: A Beloved Father
item.description: Testimonial from Ethel Georgina Reynolds Smith (President Joseph Fielding Smith's wife)depicts the tender heart and loving nature of her husband.

item.title: Teachings of Joseph Fielding Smith: A Voice of Warning
item.description: President Smith urges all people to prepare for the coming of the Savior throughobedience to commandments.

item.title: Teachings of Joseph Fielding Smith: Sanctity of the Family
item.description: President Smith seeks to strengthen the Family Home Evening program, pleading with parents to teach the Gospel to their children in their homes.

item.title: Testimony of Joseph Fielding Smith
item.description: President Joseph Fielding Smith testifies that the work of the Lord will not fail, and that the Savior's true Church bears His name, His priesthood, and His doctrine.

item.title: Ministry of Harold B. Lee: Organizing the Church Welfare Program
item.description: Harold B. Lee is called to help oversee the Church Welfare Program, following the existing organization and purposes of the priesthood.

item.title: Preparation of Harold B. Lee: Learning to Care for the Needy
item.description: As a Stake President, and during the Depression, Harold B. Lee strives to care for the poverty-stricken members of his stake.

item.title: Preparation of Harold B. Lee: Boyhood Revelation
item.description: As a boy, Harold is warned by an unseen voice to stay away from an old barn.

item.title: Ministry of Harold B. Lee: Priesthood Correlation is Created
item.description: Under the direction of President David O. McKay, Elder Harold B. Lee is called to oversee the affairs of Church Correlation, that the homes and families of the Church may be blessed.

item.title: Ministry of Harold B. Lee: The Purposes of Priesthood Correlation
item.description: President Harold B. Lee teaches that the long-range purposes of Church Correlation are to strengthen the home, strengthen the priesthood quorums, and promote faith and testimony in the Church.

item.title: Teachings of Harold B. Lee: Protecting the Home, Marriage, and Family
item.description: President Lee teaches of the importance of strengthening families by teaching the Gospel of Jesus Christ in the home.

item.title: Teachings of Harold B. Lee: Safety in Obeying God's Commandments
item.description: President Lee urges members to obey the counsel of Church leaders.

item.title: Teachings of Harold B. Lee: Obedience Learned Through Suffering
item.description: In the deaths of his wife and daugther, Harold B. Lee learns compassion and submission.

item.title: Testimony of Harold B. Lee
item.description: Harold B. Lee testifies that the Lord is not an absentee Master, but that He stands at the head of the Church.

item.title: Preparation of Spencer W. Kimball: His Call to the Apostleship
item.description: With his call to the apostleship, Elder Kimball speaks of his wrestle with the Lord, and the final peace that accompanied his sense of inadequacy.

item.title: Preparation of Spencer W. Kimball: Perfect Attendance at Primary
item.description: Young Spencer Kimball senses the importance of spiritual priorities, making Primary attendance a worthy goal.

item.title: Preparation of Spencer W. Kimball: A Young Boy Reads the Entire Bible
item.description: As a boy, Spencer W. Kimball accepts the challenge of a visiting General Authority to read the entire Bible.

item.title: Preparation of Spencer W. Kimball: Prepared to Become a Great Leader
item.description: Spencer W. Kimball is prepared from childhood to become a leader in the Church.

item.title: Ministry of Spencer W. Kimball: The Priesthood to All Worthy Men
item.description: President Spencer W. Kimball describes the sacred details surrounding the revelation that the priesthood would be available to all worthy males.

item.title: Ministry of Spencer W. Kimball: An Apostle to the Lamanites
item.description: Spencer W. Kimball oversees Church programs that will bless the lives of Native Americans.

item.title: Teachings of Spencer W. Kimball: Repentance and Forgiveness
item.description: Spencer W. Kimball authors the book, "The Miracle of Forgiveness."

item.title: Teachings of Spencer W. Kimball: Man of Compassion
item.description: Elder Spencer W. Kimball blesses a tiny Native American boy in Denver, Colorado.

item.title: Ministry of Spencer W. Kimball: Expanded Missionary Force
item.description: President Kimball invites all to "lengthen their stride" when it comes to missionary work.

item.title: Testimony of Spencer W. Kimball
item.description: President Spencer W. Kimball testifies of the truthfulness of the Gospel, and the reality of God the Father and Jesus Christ, His Son.

item.title: Ministry of Ezra Taft Benson: A Mission President in Europe
item.description: Shortly after World War II, Ezra Taft Benson is called as a mission president to oversee the affairs of the Church in war-torn Europe.

item.title: Preparation of Ezra Taft Benson: A Missionary's Prayer
item.description: Surrounded by a rough crowd in England, young missionary Elder Ezra Taft Benson prays for deliverance. See what happens next…

item.title: Preparation of Ezra Taft Benson: His Father's Mission
item.description: Through the missionary letters sent home from his father, Ezra Taft Benson feels the spirit of mission work and gains a testimony thereof.

item.title: Preparation of Ezra Taft Benson: The Example of a Devoted Father
item.description: Ezra Taft Benson is prepared to become a servant of the Lord by learning the skills of farming and the responsibilities of labor at the feet of his father.

item.title: Ministry of Ezra Taft Benson: A Latter-day Saint in Washington, D.C.
item.description: Ezra Taft Benson is appointed Secretary of Agriculture by President Dwight Eisenhower. See how he handled the pressure of politics…

item.title: Ministry of Ezra Taft Benson: The Book of Mormon to Flood the Earth
item.description: President Ezra Taft Benson pleads with the members of the Church to spread the Book of Mormon across the globe. Experience the spirit of his message…

item.title: Teachings of Ezra Taft Benson: Patriotism and Love of Country
item.description: Ezra Taft Benson receives the U.S. Presidential Citizens medal from President George H. W. Bush, recognizing outstanding service to country.

item.title: Teachings of Ezra Taft Benson: The Book of Mormon Teaches of Christ
item.description: President Benson testifies of the influence of the Book of Mormon in bringing the children of men unto Christ. Learn about Christ in the Book of Mormon.

item.title: Teachings of Ezra Taft Benson: Pride
item.description: President Ezra Taft Benson warns against the sin of pride. Watch as President Hinckley delivers this famous talk at General Conference in 1989…

item.title: Testimony of Ezra Taft Benson
item.description: President Benson testifies of Christ, the Book of Mormon, Joseph Smith, and the restored Gospel, then blesses the membership of the Church.

item.title: Preparation of Howard W. Hunter: Contributing to the Building Fund
item.description: As a young boy, Howard Hunter helps raise money for the new tabernacle in Boise.

item.title: Preparation of Howard W. Hunter: Desire to Pass the Sacrament
item.description: Young Howard Hunter seeks permission of his non-LDS father to be ordained a deacon.

item.title: Preparation of Howard W. Hunter: Always Had a Testimony
item.description: Howard Hunter's mother teaches him to be thankful and prayerful.

item.title: Preparation of Howard W. Hunter: Adams Ward Young Adult Sunday School Class
item.description: The teachings of an inspired Sunday School instructor and the revelatory experience of a patriarchal blessing serve as spiritual guides for young Howard W. Hunter.

item.title: Ministry of Howard W. Hunter: Love for the Temple
item.description: Howard W. Hunter's parents join him at the Mesa, Arizona temple, and there are sealed.

item.title: Ministry of Howard W. Hunter: Love for the Holy Land
item.description: Howard W. Hunter is instrumental is solidifying relationships between the Church and Israel. Shortly thereafter, the BYU Jerusalem Center is built.

item.title: Teachings of Howard W. Hunter: A Christ-centered Life
item.description: President Howard W. Hunter teaches that we must be about Heavenly Father's work just as His Son exemplified.

item.title: Teachings of Howard W. Hunter: Overcoming Adversity
item.description: President Howard W. Hunter faces adversity, placing faith in Christ and submitting to His will.

item.title: Teachings of Howard W. Hunter: Every Member Temple-Worthy
item.description: Having been raised in a part-member family, Howard W. Hunter teaches of the importance of temple blessings in the lives of every member of the Church.

item.title: Ministry of Howard W. Hunter: Putting the Lord First
item.description: In the face of life's challenges, Howard W. Hunter puts the Lord first and acknowledges His blessings.

item.title: Testimony of Howard W. Hunter
item.description: President Howard W. Hunter testifies of the divine mission of Jesus Christ, and the truthfulness of the Church.

item.title: Preparation of Gordon B. Hinckley: A Testimony of Joseph Smith
item.description: Attending a priesthood meeting with his father, young Gordon Hinckley hears men sing of the Prophet Joseph Smith.

item.title: Preparation of Gordon B. Hinckley: Following the Crowd
item.description: Young Gordon Hinckley learns that following the crowd can lead to trouble.

item.title: Preparation of Gordon B. Hinckley: Forget Yourself and Go to Work
item.description: A missionary letter from his father motivates Elder Gordon Hinckley to dedicate himself to the Lord's work.

item.title: Ministry of Gordon B. Hinckley: Love for the People
item.description: While preparing for a ground-breaking ceremony, President Hinckley learns that an old missionary companion is in the audience. He seeks him out.

item.title: Teachings of Gordon B. Hinckley: Standing for Something
item.description: President Gordon B. Hinckley teaches of honesty, morality, forgiveness, and gratitude.

item.title: Teachings of Gordon B. Hinckley: Be a Little Kinder
item.description: President Gordon B. Hinckley teaches the Saints to show kindness and love to all.

item.title: Teachings of Gordon B. Hinckley: The Six "B"s
item.description: President Gordon B. Hinckley instructs the youth of the Church of their divinity and nobility.

item.title: Testimony of Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: President Gordon B. Hinckley testifies of Jesus Christ and his love for the Master.

item.title: Ministry of Gordon B. Hinckley: Temple Building
item.description: The construction of temples across the globe allows the blessings of the temple to attend LDS families wherever they reside.

item.title: Ministry of Gordon B. Hinckley: Bringing the Church Out of Obscurity
item.description: President Gordon B. Hinckley wins the respect of the media across the globe.

item.title: Preparation of Thomas S. Monson: Always Follow the Promptings of the Spirit
item.description: As a young Bishop, Thomas Monson is prompted to visit a friend suffering in the hospital.

item.title: Preparation of Thomas S. Monson: Faith in the Priesthood
item.description: As a young soldier at boot camp, Thomas Monson exercises his priesthood at the request of a fellow soldier.

item.title: Preparation of Thomas S. Monson: He Learned Compassion in His Youth
item.description: Young Thomas Monson learns compassion for the less fortunate by watching the example of his Father.

item.title: Ministry of Thomas S. Monson: The New Publication of the Standard Works
item.description: Thomas S. Monson's unique experiences in the world of publication prepare and qualify him for the work of overseeing the printing of the Church's new scriptures.

item.title: Ministry of Thomas S. Monson: The Church Grows in Eastern Europe
item.description: Apostle Thomas S. Monson helps oversee the furthering the work of the Church in Europe.

item.title: Teachings of Thomas S. Monson: Rescuing Those in Need
item.description: Bishop Thomas Monson and his ward welcome a poor German family into their community, providing them with housing, warmth, and food for Christmas.

item.title: Teachings of Thomas S. Monson: Following the Promptings of the Spirit
item.description: Young Bishop Thomas Monson fails to head the prompting of the Spirit.

item.title: Ministry of Thomas S. Monson: Rebuilding Lives
item.description: An invitation to write an article for the Washington Post, ten years after the atrocities of 9/11, allows President Thomas S. Monson to speak to the world of foregiveness and hope.

item.title: Testimony of Thomas S. Monson
item.description: President Thomas S. Monson testifies of the truthfulness of the Gospel.

item.title: Glad Tidings: The History of Baptisms for the Dead
item.description: Joseph Smith's struggle with his brother Alvin's death led eventually to the introduction of baptisms for the dead. This new ordinance was embraced by saints in Nauvoo who did the first genealogical and family history research in Church history.

item.title: Lost Sermons
item.description: George Watt captured the sermons of Brigham Young and other early Church leaders in shorthand. Many of these sermons have remained unknown until recently transcribed. This will be the first publication of some of these sermons.

item.title: Using the LDS Church History Library
item.description: Learn how to use the Church History Library of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Salt Lake City, Utah, USA

item.title: The Story Lives Here
item.description: The Story Lives Here highlights the purpose and talks about some of the work that takes place at the Church History Museum in Salt Lake City, UT.

item.title: Church History Catalog: Gideon Tolman
item.description: Gideon Tolman explains how to use the Church History Catalog

item.title: Church History Catalog: Christine Cox
item.description: Librarian Christine Cox explains why she likes the Church History Catalog

item.title: Church History Catalog: Joseph Soderborg
item.description: Researcher Joseph Soderborg explains why he likes the Church History Catalog

item.title: Using the LDS Church History Library
item.description: Learn how to use the Church History Library of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Salt Lake City, Utah, USA

item.title: A Journals Journey from Donations to Shelf
item.description: A documentary style orientation video for Church History Department missionaries about how materials make it from being donated to the department to the being available to the public through the library archives.

item.title: Joseph Smith Papers, Documents Vol. 1, Gerrit Dirkmaat
item.description: Historian Gerrit Dirkmaat tells interesting stories discovered in the newest Joseph Smith Papers volume, Documents 1

item.title: Joseph Smith Papers, Documents Vol. 2, Matthew Godfrey
item.description: Historian Matthew Godfrey tells interesting stories discovered in the new Joseph Smith Papers volume, Documents 2

item.title: Joseph Smith Papers, Documents Series, Ron Esplin
item.description: Historian Ron Esplin explains why the Documents Series is the backbone of Joseph Smith Papers project

item.title: Joseph Smith Papers: Karen Davidson and John Corrill
item.description: Karen Davidson, historian on the Joseph Smith Papers, introduces John Corrill, a man who served in the bishopric, was elected to the Missouri legislature, and wrote a history by assignment from Jospeh Smith. However, as the struggles in Missouri inte

item.title: Joseph Smith Papers: Richard Jensen and Missouri Mormon War
item.description: Richard Jensen, historian on Joseph Smith Papers, describes the conflict that became the Missouri Mormon War. After Joseph Smith ordered a pre-emptive strike and Governor Boggs issued the extermination order, Sidney Rigdon’s appeal to the US governme

item.title: Joseph Smith Papers: Nathan Waite and Edward Partridge
item.description: Nathan Waite of The Church Historian’s Press discusses Edward Partridge’s account of Missouri persecutions in Histories, Volume 2.

item.title: Joseph Smith Papers: Constance Lewis and Four Church Historians
item.description: Constance Lewis, and editor on the Joseph Smith Papers Project, introduces us to William Phelps, John Whitmer, John Corrill, and Edward Partridge. She explains how the lives of these four historians had a significant impact on the documents included

item.title: Joseph Smith Papers: Nathan Waite and Nathan Partridge
item.description: Nathan Waite, an editor on the Joseph Smith Papers project, says that the history of Edward Partridge includes stories familiar to Latter-Day Saints, but also includes a story about the trial and near murder of church leaders when news of a gunfight

item.title: Joseph Smith Histories Overview
item.description: Karen Davidson talks about the Joseph Papers and how the histories volume is different from the rest of the series.

item.title: Joseph Smith Forgives Harvey Whitlock
item.description: Story from the papers of the prophet Joseph Smith featuring Richard Jensen: Joseph forgives Harvey Whitlock.

item.title: Joseph Smith Writes an Essay about Latter-day Saints
item.description: Story from the papers of the prophet Joseph Smith featuring Karen Davidson: Joseph writes an essay about the latter-day saints.

item.title: Joseph Smith and the First Vision
item.description: Story from the paper of the prophet Joseph Smith featuring Mark Ashurst-McGee: Joseph and the First Vision.

item.title: Joseph Smith Knows A Record Shall Be Kept
item.description: A story from the papers of the prophet Joseph Smith featuring Dean Jessee: Joseph knows a record shall be kept regarding the history of the church.

item.title: Joseph Smith Chief Justice And Mayor Of Nauvoo
item.description: Announcing the second volume in the best-selling Journal series for the Joseph Smith Papers. Alex Smith tells the story of the Joseph Smith in his position as chief justice and mayor of Nauvoo.

item.title: Emma Smith And The Governor Of Illinois
item.description: Announcing the second volume in the series for the Joseph Smith Papers. Andrew Hedges tells the story of Emma, as she writes a letter to the Governor of Illinois. Emma explains why the court case against Joseph Smith was unfair and unfounded.

item.title: Reference Materials To Learn More About Joseph Smith
item.description: Richard Jensen talks about how the reference material in the Journals allows for him to explore the pages of history and learn about the inner workings of the Church, the city of Nauvoo, and the Nauvoo Legion.

item.title: Joseph Smith And The Organizing Of The Relief Society
item.description: Announcing the second volume in the best-selling Journal series for the Joseph Smith Papers. Kate Holbrook tells the story of the Relief Society organization and the commission that Joseph Smith gave the women of the church.

item.title: Chelsea Speirs
item.description: An interview with a young artist named Chelsea Speirs about her submitted artwork for the Church History Museum’s 2012 international art competition for youth.

item.title: Jeffery Robert Pugh, Early Spring, 1820
item.description: Jeffery Pugh discusses his painting “Early Spring, 1820.”

item.title: Elspeth Caitlin Young, I Will Send Their Words Forth (Jacob the Teacher)
item.description: Elspeth Young discusses her painting “I Will Send Their Words Forth.”

item.title: Nick Stephens, The Same Yesterday, Today, and Forever
item.description: Nick Stephens discusses his painting “The Same Yesterday, Today, and Forever.”

item.title: David Andre Koch, Feed My Sheep
item.description: David Koch discusses his painting “Feed My Sheep.”

item.title: Julie Rogers, Charity Never Faileth
item.description: Julie Rogers discusses her painting “Charity Never Faileth.”

item.title: Jodi G. Warner, Facing Outward, Reflecting Inward: Temple Buildings Teach
item.description: Jodi Warner discusses her quilt “Facing Outward, Reflecting Inward: Temple Buildings Teach.”

item.title: Ashton Young, A Damsel Came to Hearken (Rhoda)
item.description: Ashton Young discusses his painting “A Damsel Came to Hearken.”

item.title: Al Young, The Miracle of Forgiveness
item.description: Al Young discusses his painting "The Miracle of Forgiveness."

item.title: Cassandra Barney, Flannel-Board Story
item.description: Cassandra Barney discusses her work “Flannel-Board Story.”

item.title: Ann Adele Henrie, Balm of Gilead
item.description: Ann Henrie discusses her painting "Balm of Gilead."

item.title: Casey Childs, Greater Love Hath No Man
item.description: Casey Childs discusses his painting “Greater Love Hath No Man.”

item.title: Youth International Art Competition
item.description: The Church History Museum invites the youth of the worldwide Church to ponder this passage in the Doctrine and Covenants and create works of art that express what the Lord's request- "Arise and Shine Forth" -means to you.

item.title: Testimony of Elaine L. Jack interviewed by Julie B. Beck
item.description: Former general Relief Society president Sister Jack bears her testimony on February 10, 2009 during an interview with Sister Beck.

item.title: Testimony of Mary Ellen W. Smoot interviewed by Julie B. Beck
item.description: Former general Relief Society president Sister Smoot bears her testimony on May 20, 2009 during an interview with Sister Beck.

item.title: Testimony of Bonnie D. Parkin interviewed by Julie B. Beck
item.description: Former general Relief Society president Sister Parkin bears her testimony on August 22,2011 during an interview with Sister Beck.

item.title: Testimony of Julie B. Beck interviewed by Sharon Eubank
item.description: General Relief Society president Sister Beck bears her testimony on January 19, 2012 during an interview with Sharon Eubank.

item.title: Testimony of Barbara W. Winder interviewed by Julie B. Beck
item.description: Former general Relief Society president Sister Winder bears her testimony on February 10, 2009 during an interview with Sister Beck.

item.title: Testimony of Barbara B. Smith interviewed by Julie B. Beck
item.description: Former general Relief Society president Sister Smith bears her testimony on December 10, 2008 during an interview with Sister Beck.

item.title: An Interview with Julie Beck
item.description: Julie Beck, the fifteenth Relief Society general president, discusses her work with the women’s organization as it grew into a worldwide society. Sister Beck served from 2007 until 2012 and oversaw the publication of Daughters in My Kingdom.

item.title: An Interview with Mary Ellen Smoot
item.description: Julie Beck sits down with Mary Ellen Smoot, the thirteenth Relief Society general president, who served from 1997 until 2002. Sister Smoot’s presidency oversaw the creation of the Relief Society declaration and reemphasized the importance of service.

item.title: An Interview with Elaine Jack
item.description: Julie Beck sits down with Elaine Jack, the twelfth Relief Society general president. Sister Jack served from 1990 until 1997 and was a driving force behind the changes in the organization’s curriculum that took place during that era.

item.title: An Interview with Barbara Winder
item.description: Julie Beck sits down with Barbara Winder, the eleventh Relief Society general president. Sister Winder was at the helm of the Relief Society from 1984 until 1990 and helped simplify the organization for the needs of the increasingly global Church.

item.title: An Interview with Barbara Smith
item.description: Julie Beck sits down with Barbara Smith, the tenth Relief Society general president. Sister Smith served from 1974 until 1984, overseeing the women’s organization at a time when the Equal Rights Amendment was a hot-button issue.

item.title: Men & Women of Faith August 2013 David A Hall
item.description: Accompanying her mission president husband to Europe in 1936, Amy Brown Lyman, serving as a counselor in the general Relief Society presidency, faced the challenge of adapting programs developed in the Mormon heartland to conditions world-wide.

item.title: Men & Women of Faith July 2013 Benjamin Pykles
item.description: From 1889 to 1917, Latter-day Saint converts from Polynesia settled in Iosepa in Utah’s Skull Valley. Archaeological investigations at the town site have revealed how these pioneers from the Pacific sought to make the desert "blossom as the rose."

item.title: Men & Women of Faith June 2013 Jay A Parry
item.description: The teachings of the gospel and the fellowship of the Church strengthened, blessed, and comforted the faithful Latter-­day Saint women in East Germany as they endured the trials of war.

item.title: Men & Women of Faith May 2013 Debbie J Christensen
item.description: The lives of Julia and Emily Hill, their experiences in the Willie handcart company, and how they served as the inspiration for the hymn "As Sisters in Zion."

item.title: Men & Women of Faith April 2013 Joseph McConkie
item.description: Joseph Fielding McConkie presents about the life and teachings of his father, Bruce R. McConkie.

item.title: Men & Women of Faith March 2013 Julie B. Beck
item.description: Sister Julie B. Beck speaks about her calling as General Relief Society President, some of her experiences with sisters around the world, the writing of Daughters In My Kingdom, and working with individuals who were not members of the Church.

item.title: Men & Women of Faith February 2013 Steven E Snow
item.description: Elder Steven E. Snow, Church Historian, presents a lecture on his ancestor, Erastus Snow, including details of the opening of the Scandanavian Mission and colonization of Southern Utah.

item.title: Men and Women of Faith August 2012 Ann Cannon Woodburry
item.description: Men and Women of Faith Lecture Series, Kim Woodburry discusses the life of Ann Cannon Woodburry.

item.title: Men and Women of Faith June 2012 M. Bryce Fifield
item.description: The Untold Story of Mormon Pioneers with Disabilities is presented by M. Bryce Fifield at the Church History Library on June 14, 2012.

item.title: Men and Women of Faith April 2012 Anne Leahy and Doug Stringham
item.description: In April 2012, Anne Leahy and Doug Stringham discuss the testimonies of Deaf Latter-day Saints from 1846-1916.

item.title: Men and Women of Faith March 2012 Jane Manning James
item.description: The Church History Department presents Jane Manning James in the Men and Women of Faith Lecture series, March 2012.

item.title: Men and Women of Faith February 2012 Marcus Nash
item.description: The Church History department presents Marcus Nash in the Men and Women of Faith Lecture Series, February 2012.

item.title: Preservation Housing for Objects
item.description: Valuable historical objects include artifacts, statues, etc. Do you have historical objects you would like to preserve? Learn how to house and store them properly.

item.title: Proper Handling of Objects and Textiles
item.description: Proper handling of historic objects and textiles is critical to preserving their life. Learn how to handle them properly.

item.title: Proper Handling of Paintings
item.description: Proper handling of paintings is critical to preserving their life. Learn how to handle them properly.

item.title: Preservation Housing for Textiles
item.description: Textiles are cloth or woven fabric. Do you have textiles you would like to preserve? Learn how to house and store them properly.

item.title: Preservation Housing for Paintings
item.description: Do you have paintings you would like to preserve? Learn how to house and store them properly.

item.title: Using an Audio Recorder
item.description: See how to quickly set-up and run the Tascam DR-05. Also, learn how to appropriately move recorded files onto a computer and name them correctly.

item.title: Steps to an Oral History Interview
item.description: See the basic steps to conducting an effective oral history interview.

item.title: Oral Histories Introduction
item.description: A basic introduction of how to prepare for, record, process, and submit an oral history to the Church History Department.

item.title: Processing an Oral History Interview
item.description: See the steps to processing an oral history interview preparatory to submitting it to the Church History Department.

item.title: Preservation Housing for Books and Paper Documents
item.description: How to properly house books and paper documents to prevent them from becoming damaged.

item.title: Preservation Housing for Photographs
item.description: How to properly house photographs to keep them from being damaged.

item.title: Proper Handling of Electronic Media
item.description: How to properly handle electronic media to keep it from being damaged.

item.title: Proper Handling of Books, Documents, and Photographs
item.description: How to properly handle rare and/or fragile books, documents, and photographs.

item.title: Preservation Housing for Electronic Media
item.description: How to properly house electronic media to keep it from being damaged.

item.title: Why Keep Records
item.description: Why should we keep historical records? President Spencer W. Kimball reminded us that "From time immemorial the Lord has counseled us to be a record-keeping people.

item.title: Safe Home Display
item.description: There are several ways to keep items on display in your home from becoming faded and damaged over time.

item.title: Digital Storage
item.description: It’s important to have a good system to keep digital files from being lost, deleted, or corrupted to the point that they are unreadable.

item.title: Storage
item.description: There are several ways you can preserve documents and artifacts at home, most of which involve controlling the environment in which they are stored.

item.title: Conservation
item.description: Many of our attempts at conserving documents and artifacts actually damages them, but there are some methods that work.

item.title: Housing
item.description: One of the best ways to protect documents and artifacts is to properly house them in archival containers.

item.title: Health Precautions
item.description: There are precautions you should take whenever you’re dealing with dusty or dirty documents.

item.title: Handling
item.description: Handling documents and artifacts properly is essential to preserving their life.

item.title: Introduction
item.description: Introduction to Preserving History video series

item.title: Preservation Through Organization
item.description: Without organization, there is no real preservation. When your records are organized, you keep them from damage and loss.
